thread.title: Morris football's offense struggles in loss to Kaneland
thread.title_full: Morris football's offense struggles in loss to Kaneland

title: Morris football's offense struggles in loss to Kaneland
text:
Morris football's offense struggles in loss to Kaneland Published: Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 12:41 a.m. CDT • Updated: Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015 4:49 a.m. CDT Caption (Dan Voitik for Shaw Media) Morris' Tommy Balentine tries to evade Kaneland defenders in a 23-7 loss Friday night. Balentine scored the only Redskin touchdown. Caption (Dan Voitik for Shaw Media) Morris running back Michael Feeney breaks into the clear during a 23-7 loss to Kaneland on Friday night. Feeney led the Redskins with 71 rushing yards. Caption (Dan Voitik for Shaw Media) Morris defensive back Nathan Guth (left) breaks up a pass intended for Kaneland's Mitchel Groen as teammate Michael Cryder looks on. Kaneland beat Morris, 23-7. By ROB OESTERLE - roesterle@shawmedia.com 
MORRIS — The first drive for the Morris football team Friday night covered 90 yards and resulted in a touchdown. Related Links Morris aims to derail powerful DeKalb offense 
Unfortunately for the Redskins (3-4, 0-3), it was the last time they scored, as Kaneland forced five turnovers and scored on both a fumble return and a safety to lead the Knights to a 23-7 victory. 
Tommy Balentine scooped up teammate Nathan Guth's fumble at the Kaneland 30 on Morris' first drive and ran the rest of the way into the end zone to give Morris a 7-0 lead. Kaneland answered with a 22-yard touchdown pass from Jacob Marczuk to Tanner Robertsen in the second quarter and then scored on a two-yard run by Jonathan Alstott with 25 seconds left in the first half to take a 14-7 halftime lead. 
Kaneland then scored on a 15-yard fumble return by Austin Vickery and got a safety when they recovered a fumble in the end zone. The Knights had three interceptions and two fumble recoveries.
